channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: RAPIDFlow: Recurrent Adaptable Pyramids with Iterative Decoding for Efficient Optical Flow Estimation
item.description: Extracting motion information from videos with optical flow estimation is vital in multiple practical robot applications.

item.title: TFPred: Learning Discriminative Representations from Unlabeled Data for Few-Label Rotating Machinery Fault Diagnosis
item.description: Recent advances in intelligent rotating machinery fault diagnosis have been enabled by the availability of massive labeled training data.

item.title: Lightplane: Highly-Scalable Components for Neural 3D Fields
item.description: Contemporary 3D research, particularly in reconstruction and generation, heavily relies on 2D images for inputs or supervision.

item.title: Debiased Collaborative Filtering with Kernel-Based Causal Balancing
item.description: Inspired by these gaps, we propose to approximate the balancing functions in reproducing kernel Hilbert space and demonstrate that, based on the universal property and representer theorem of kernel functions, the causal balancing constraints can be better satisfied.

item.title: Context-Aware Machine Translation with Source Coreference Explanation
item.description: Despite significant improvements in enhancing the quality of translation, context-aware machine translation (MT) models underperform in many cases.

item.title: Multi-Scale Heterogeneity-Aware Hypergraph Representation for Histopathology Whole Slide Images
item.description: Survival prediction is a complex ordinal regression task that aims to predict the survival coefficient ranking among a cohort of patients, typically achieved by analyzing patients' whole slide images.

item.title: Neural Controlled Differential Equations with Quantum Hidden Evolutions
item.description: We introduce a class of neural controlled differential equation inspired by quantum mechanics.

item.title: SemiPL: A Semi-supervised Method for Event Sound Source Localization
item.description: In recent years, Event Sound Source Localization has been widely applied in various fields.

item.title: KAN: Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks
item.description: Inspired by the Kolmogorov-Arnold representation theorem, we propose Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KANs) as promising alternatives to Multi-Layer Perceptrons (MLPs).

item.title: Masked Multi-Query Slot Attention for Unsupervised Object Discovery
item.description: Moreover, we extend the slot attention to a multi-query approach, allowing the model to learn multiple sets of slots, producing more stable masks.

item.title: Masked Spatial Propagation Network for Sparsity-Adaptive Depth Refinement
item.description: The main function of depth completion is to compensate for an insufficient and unpredictable number of sparse depth measurements of hardware sensors.

item.title: Provably Robust Conformal Prediction with Improved Efficiency
item.description: To address these limitations, we first propose a novel framework called RSCP+ to provide provable robustness guarantee in evaluation, which fixes the issues in the original RSCP method.

item.title: PCA for Point Processes
item.description: By treating point process realizations as random measures, we adopt a functional analysis perspective and propose a form of functional Principal Component Analysis (fPCA) for point processes.

item.title: Neural Dynamic Data Valuation
item.description: Data constitute the foundational component of the data economy and its marketplaces.

item.title: Explicit Correlation Learning for Generalizable Cross-Modal Deepfake Detection
item.description: With the rising prevalence of deepfakes, there is a growing interest in developing generalizable detection methods for various types of deepfakes.

item.title: G2LTraj: A Global-to-Local Generation Approach for Trajectory Prediction
item.description: Finally, to ensure the optimal granularity of key steps, we design a selectable granularity strategy that caters to each predicted trajectory.

item.title: Mixed Continuous and Categorical Flow Matching for 3D De Novo Molecule Generation
item.description: In this work, we explore the use of flow matching, a recently proposed generative modeling framework that generalizes diffusion models, for the task of de novo molecule generation.

item.title: AnomalyXFusion: Multi-modal Anomaly Synthesis with Diffusion
item.description: The AnomalyXFusion framework comprises two distinct yet synergistic modules: the Multi-modal In-Fusion (MIF) module and the Dynamic Dif-Fusion (DDF) module.

item.title: Extending Llama-3's Context Ten-Fold Overnight
item.description: We extend the context length of Llama-3-8B-Instruct from 8K to 80K via QLoRA fine-tuning.

item.title: Computational Approaches for Integrating out Subjectivity in Cognate Synonym Selection
item.description: However, as we show here, binary character matrices, which are used as input for computational methods, do allow for representing the entire dataset including all synonyms.

item.title: MicroDreamer: Zero-shot 3D Generation in $\sim$20 Seconds by Score-based Iterative Reconstruction
item.description: In this paper, we introduce score-based iterative reconstruction (SIR), an efficient and general algorithm for 3D generation with a multi-view score-based diffusion model.

item.title: CLIP-Mamba: CLIP Pretrained Mamba Models with OOD and Hessian Evaluation
item.description: State space models and Mamba-based models have been increasingly applied across various domains, achieving state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: RAG and RAU: A Survey on Retrieval-Augmented Language Model in Natural Language Processing
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have catalyzed significant advancements in Natural Language Processing (NLP), yet they encounter challenges such as hallucination and the need for domain-specific knowledge.

item.title: Temporal Graph ODEs for Irregularly-Sampled Time Series
item.description: Modern graph representation learning works mostly under the assumption of dealing with regularly sampled temporal graph snapshots, which is far from realistic, e. g., social networks and physical systems are characterized by continuous dynamics and sporadic observations.

item.title: Pessimistic Value Iteration for Multi-Task Data Sharing in Offline Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We further provide theoretical analysis, which shows that the optimality gap of our method is only related to the expected data coverage of the shared dataset, thus resolving the distribution shift issue in data sharing.

item.title: MGCBS: An Optimal and Efficient Algorithm for Solving Multi-Goal Multi-Agent Path Finding Problem
item.description: However, this paper demonstrates that the methods based on DVS cannot always obtain the optimal solution.

item.title: Be Aware of the Neighborhood Effect: Modeling Selection Bias under Interference
item.description: On this basis, we propose a novel ideal loss that can be used to deal with selection bias in the presence of neighborhood effect.

item.title: Countering Reward Over-optimization in LLM with Demonstration-Guided Reinforcement Learning
item.description: While Reinforcement Learning (RL) has been proven essential for tuning large language models (LLMs), it can lead to reward over-optimization (ROO).

item.title: Uncertainty-boosted Robust Video Activity Anticipation
item.description: Video activity anticipation aims to predict what will happen in the future, embracing a broad application prospect ranging from robot vision and autonomous driving.

item.title: Benchmarking Benchmark Leakage in Large Language Models
item.description: By analyzing 31 LLMs under the context of mathematical reasoning, we reveal substantial instances of training even test set misuse, resulting in potentially unfair comparisons.

item.title: Semantic Line Combination Detector
item.description: A novel algorithm, called semantic line combination detector (SLCD), to find an optimal combination of semantic lines is proposed in this paper.

item.title: Machine Unlearning for Document Classification
item.description: In our research, we explore machine unlearning for document classification problems, representing, to the best of our knowledge, the first investigation into this area.

item.title: FlexiFilm: Long Video Generation with Flexible Conditions
item.description: Generating long and consistent videos has emerged as a significant yet challenging problem.

item.title: Enabling Efficient and Flexible Interpretability of Data-driven Anomaly Detection in Industrial Processes with AcME-AD
item.description: While Machine Learning has become crucial for Industry 4. 0, its opaque nature hinders trust and impedes the transformation of valuable insights into actionable decision, a challenge exacerbated in the evolving Industry 5. 0 with its human-centric focus.

item.title: A Universal Metric of Dataset Similarity for Cross-silo Federated Learning
item.description: As the first federated dataset similarity metric, we believe this metric can better facilitate successful collaborations between sites.

item.title: Analyzing Semantic Change through Lexical Replacements
item.description: Furthermore, we leverage the replacement schema as a basis for a novel \textit{interpretable} model for semantic change.

item.title: Self-supervised learning for classifying paranasal anomalies in the maxillary sinus
item.description: Lastly, we fine-tune the encoder part of the 3D CNN on a labelled dataset of normal and anomalous MS images.

item.title: Unifying Simulation and Inference with Normalizing Flows
item.description: There have been many applications of deep neural networks to detector calibrations and a growing number of studies that propose deep generative models as automated fast detector simulators.

item.title: Saliency Suppressed, Semantics Surfaced: Visual Transformations in Neural Networks and the Brain
item.description: Deep learning algorithms lack human-interpretable accounts of how they transform raw visual input into a robust semantic understanding, which impedes comparisons between different architectures, training objectives, and the human brain.

item.title: A Survey on Diffusion Models for Time Series and Spatio-Temporal Data
item.description: Conditioned models, on the other hand, utilize extra information to enhance performance and are similarly divided for both predictive and generative tasks.

item.title: What Drives Performance in Multilingual Language Models?
item.description: This study investigates the factors influencing the performance of multilingual large language models (MLLMs) across diverse languages.

item.title: LLM-SR: Scientific Equation Discovery via Programming with Large Language Models
item.description: Mathematical equations have been unreasonably effective in describing complex natural phenomena across various scientific disciplines.

item.title: Post-hoc and manifold explanations analysis of facial expression data based on deep learning
item.description: This study not only advances the application of AI technology in the field of psychology but also provides a new psychological theoretical understanding the information processing of the AI.

item.title: Time Series Data Augmentation as an Imbalanced Learning Problem
item.description: We use these techniques to create synthetic time series observations and improve the accuracy of forecasting models.

item.title: Leak Proof CMap; a framework for training and evaluation of cell line agnostic L1000 similarity methods
item.description: The Connectivity Map (CMap) is a large publicly available database of cellular transcriptomic responses to chemical and genetic perturbations built using a standardized acquisition protocol known as the L1000 technique.

item.title: 3AM: An Ambiguity-Aware Multi-Modal Machine Translation Dataset
item.description: Experimental results show that MMT models trained on our dataset exhibit a greater ability to exploit visual information than those trained on other MMT datasets.

item.title: BMRetriever: Tuning Large Language Models as Better Biomedical Text Retrievers
item.description: Developing effective biomedical retrieval models is important for excelling at knowledge-intensive biomedical tasks but still challenging due to the deficiency of sufficient publicly annotated biomedical data and computational resources.

item.title: SpherE: Expressive and Interpretable Knowledge Graph Embedding for Set Retrieval
item.description: We show that the set retrieval highly depends on expressive modeling of many-to-many relations, and propose a new KG embedding model SpherE to address this problem.

item.title: Evaluating the effectiveness of predicting covariates in LSTM Networks for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Surprisingly, even when provided with covariates informing the network about future target values, multivariate predictions exhibited inferior performance.

item.title: Predicting Safety Misbehaviours in Autonomous Driving Systems using Uncertainty Quantification
item.description: The automated real-time recognition of unexpected situations plays a crucial role in the safety of autonomous vehicles, especially in unsupported and unpredictable scenarios.
